quotes.quote: Who soars too near the sun, with golden wings, melts them.
Those who can soar to the highest heights can also plunge to the deepest depths and the natures which enjoy most keenly are those which also suffer most sharply.
It is possible to fly without motors, but not without knowledge and skill.
The courage to soar to great heights is inside all of us.
Refuse to be average. Let your heart soar as high as it will.
Do you wish toÂ rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
There is an eagle in me that wants to soar.
If you want to soar like an eagle in life, you can't be flocking with the turkeys.
You learn to rise above a lot of bad things that happen in your life. And you have to keep going.
To fly as fast as thought, you must begin by knowing that you have already arrived.
You cannot fly like an eagle with the wings of a wren.
One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
Some rise by sin, and some by virtue fall.
The lower you fall, the higher you'll fly.
Soar, eat ether, see what has never been seen; depart, be lost, but climb.
Why fly like a hen when you can soar like an eagle?
HeÂ whoÂ would learnÂ toÂ fly one day must first learnÂ toÂ standÂ andÂ walkÂ andÂ runÂ andÂ climbÂ anddance;Â one cannot fly into flying.
For the birds that cannotÂ soar, God has provided low branches.
You can't just leave out one part; the bread won'tÂ riseÂ if the yeast isn't there.
No one can predict to what heights you can soar. Even you will not know until you spread your wings.
May you soar on eagle wings, high above the madness of the world.
Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall
I too must attempt a way by which I can raise myself above the ground, andÂ soarÂ triumphant through the lips of men.
They that soar too high, often fall hard.
The higher we soar the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly.
People who soar, are those who refuse to sit back and wish things would change
Soar your wings high in the heavenly sky.
You can't soar like an eagle and crap like a canary.
Those who desire to rise as high as our human condition allows, must renounce intellectual pride, the omnipotence of clear thinking, belief in the absolute power of logic.
When youÂ soarÂ like an eagle, you attract the hunters.
